--- title: "LEW Bo Cong" about: template: trestles image: photo_of_myself.jpg image-shape: rounded links: - icon: github text: Github (Click here for NM2207 folders) href: https://github.com/bocongg/my-NM2207-repo - icon: instagram text: mbe.z href: https://www.instagram.com/mbe.z/ --- Hello! I am Bo Cong, currently a Year 3 student at NUS majoring in Life Sciences. While my passion for biological sciences has been with me since my secondary school days, I also consider myself to be a tech-savvy person and in recent times I have gained interest in web and app development. I first began exploring web development using C++ in 2018, inspired by an in-game friend who created a website for our favourite game, but it was unfruitful because I lacked guidance. Then in 2020, there was an opportunity for Full-time National Servicemen (NSF) to receive governmental funding support to attend short virtual Infocomm Technology courses, which I jumped in and learnt app development using React Native. However, I found the learning curve to be too steep. Now that I'm in university, I have had the chance to enroll in various courses (i.e. [LSM2302](https://nusmods.com/courses/LSM2302/computational-thinking-for-life-sciences) and currently [NM2207](https://nusmods.com/courses/NM2207/computational-media-literacy)) with more structured curriculum to improve my coding skills while deepening my passion for biomedical sciences. In the future, I hope to merge my knowledge in Life Sciences with web development to value-add to this field. #### **Education** National University of Singapore\ Life Sciences \| 2021 - 2025 Singapore Polytechnic\ Biomedical Sciences \| 2016 - 2019 #### **Hobbies** Photography \| Videography \| Watching Films (Just completed: The Blacklist) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Loading required package: ggplot2 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'plotly' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': last_plot ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:stats': filter ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': layout ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'bslib' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following object is masked from 'package:utils': page ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: package 'DT' was built under R version 4.3.2 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'DT' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:shiny': dataTableOutput, renderDataTable ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.3 ✔ readr 2.1.4 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.0 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ purrr 1.0.2 ✔ tidyr 1.3.0 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks plotly::filter(), stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ You have loaded plyr after dplyr -
